title: ServiceChannel
description: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

allOf.description: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

processingTime.description: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

providesService.description: The service provided by this channel.

serviceLocation.description: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

servicePhone.description: The phone number to use to access the service.

servicePostalAddress.description: The address for accessing the service by mail.

serviceSmsNumber.description: The number to access the service by text message.

serviceUrl.description: The website to access the service.
